message.content:
<<<api>>>: request.getAttribute
<<<code>>>: String scanData = (String) request.getAttribute("scanData");
if (scanData != null) {
    // Code to write scanData to text file
    request.setAttribute("scanData", ""); // Clear the scanData attribute
}
<<<explanation>>>: To clear the scanData textbox and continue entering more values, you can use the request.getAttribute method to retrieve the value of scanData. If it is not null, you can write it to the text file and then set the scanData attribute to an empty string to clear the textbox. This way, when the JSP is reloaded, the textbox will be empty and ready for the next user entry.
